This NY Times article follows the story of a high school student regularly bullied while the school administrators and teachers apparently do nothing to constructively intervene, to stop what amounts to assault and battery under their auspices.
 
 "A Boy The Bullies Love To Beat Up Repeatedly"
 
 http://www.nytimes.com/2008/03/24/us/24land.html?_r=5&hp&oref=slogin&oref=slogin&oref=slogin&oref=slogin&oref=login

We get a lot of problems surfacing here from time to time. There are undoubtedly a lot of schools (certainly I would think the vast majority) where they keep a solid grip on this. Of course, an element will make its appearance from time to time and as long as swiftly dealt with that is fine.
 
 However, there are two problems first the Education authorities who have been known to override the Schools disciplinary results with the obvious problems that causes. Second there are a number of schools where there is bullying who seem to be in denial when it is brought into the public domain

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  School Bullying
